verses.verse: “When Your people go out to battle against their enemies, wherever You send them, and when they pray to You toward this city which You have chosen and the temple which I have built for Your name,
then hear from heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.

“When they sin against You (for there is (Prov. 20:9; Eccl. 7:20; (Rom. 3:9, 19; 5:12; Gal. 3:10); James 3:2; 1 John 1:8) no one who does not sin), and You become angry with them and deliver them to the enemy, and they take them (Deut. 28:63-68) captive to a land far or near;

yet when they come to themselves in the land where they were carried captive, and repent, and make supplication to You in the land of their captivity, saying, ‘We have sinned, we have done wrong, and have committed wickedness’;

and when they return to You with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, where they have been carried captive, and pray toward their land which You gave to their fathers, the (Dan. 6:10) city which You have chosen, and toward the temple which I have built for Your name:
then hear from heaven Your dwelling place their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive Your people who have sinned against You.
Now, my God, I pray, let Your eyes be (2 Chr. 6:20) open and let Your ears be attentive to the prayer made in this place.

(Ps. 132:8-10, 16) “Now therefore, Arise, O LORD God, to Your (1 Chr. 28:2) resting place, You and the ark of Your strength. Let Your priests, O LORD God, be clothed with salvation, And let Your saints (Neh. 9:25) rejoice in goodness.
“O LORD God, do not turn away the face of Your Anointed; (2 Sam. 7:15; Ps. 89:49; 132:1, 8-10; Is. 55:3) Remember the mercies of Your servant David.”

Solomon Dedicates the Temple When (1 Kin. 8:54) Solomon had finished praying, (Lev. 9:24; Judg. 6:21; 1 Kin. 18:38; 1 Chr. 21:26) fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices; and (1 Kin. 8:10, 11) the glory of the LORD filled the temple.
(2 Chr. 5:14) And the priests could not enter the house of the LORD, because the glory of the LORD had filled the LORD’s house.

When all the children of Israel saw how the fire came down, and the glory of the LORD on the temple, they bowed their faces to the ground on the pavement, and worshiped and praised the LORD, saying: (2 Chr. 5:13; Ps. 106:1; 136:1) “For He is good, (1 Chr. 16:41; 2 Chr. 20:21) For His mercy endures forever.”
(1 Kin. 8:62, 63) Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the LORD.
King Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand bulls and one hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.

(1 Chr. 15:16) And the priests attended to their services; the Levites also with instruments of the music of the LORD, which King David had made to praise the LORD, saying, “For His mercy endures forever,” whenever David offered praise by their ministry. (2 Chr. 5:12) The priests sounded trumpets opposite them, while all Israel stood.

Furthermore (1 Kin. 8:64-66; 9:3) Solomon consecrated the middle of the court that was in front of the house of the LORD; for there he offered burnt offerings and the fat of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the fat.

(1 Kin. 8:65) At that time Solomon kept the feast seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great assembly (1 Kin. 4:21, 24; 2 Kin. 14:25) from the entrance of Hamath to (Josh. 13:3) the Brook of Egypt.
And on the eighth day they held a (Lev. 23:36) sacred assembly, for they observed the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.

(1 Kin. 8:66) On the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people away to their tents, joyful and glad of heart for the good that the LORD had done for David, for Solomon, and for His people Israel.

Thus (1 Kin. 9:1) Solomon finished the house of the LORD and the king’s house; and Solomon successfully accomplished all that came into his heart to make in the house of the LORD and in his own house.

God’s Second Appearance to Solomon Then the LORD (1 Kin. 3:5; 11:9) appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him: “I have heard your prayer, (Deut. 12:5, 11) and have chosen this (2 Chr. 6:20) place for Myself as a house of sacrifice.
